column4: I have been trying for hours to resolve this issue, and i have not been able to... when i installed and configured PPTP server it started the server and i could connect no problem.  After i restarted the ubuntu 11.10 machine, I have not been able to connect to the server.  After trying to start the server and looking at the syslog this is the error that it is logging "pptpd[20217]: MGR: PPP
options file /etc/ppp/options.pptpd#015 not readable"

I thought that there was something wrong with the file or permissions, so i created a new file and copied just the settings (no comments) from the original config to the new file and saved it with the original config name and still got the error
i changed the permissions on the file to 777 and still get the error!
fully path the client and server, then go back thru and do the setup again
when you go back through just make sure everything is set correctly based on the guide you used
what do you mean fully path the client and server?
if the client and server are both ubuntu, make sure they are fully patched (meaning install all updates)
sorry my typing lol patch instead of path
did you patch both systems fully?
If you mean apply all available updates, yes.
try to connect with a different client just to verify it's not the iphone's fault
do the files have this symbol in them ^M
you don't have to convert unless it has these in it ^M
then thats not the problem
what command are you using to start pptpd
try sudo /etc/init.d/pptpd start
well do stop then start
is there a log in /var/log ?
not that i can find for pptp
please pastebin the error
did you already pastebin your pptpd.conf
